title: Cloud Infrastructure Software Engineer II
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION


You’re ready to gain the skills and experience needed to grow within your role and advance your career — and we have the perfect software engineering opportunity for you.

As a Cloud Infrastructure Software Engineer II at JPMorgan Chase within Consumer and Community Banking - Deposits Platform team, you are part of an agile team that works to enhance, design, and deliver the software components of the firm’s state-of-the-art technology products in a secure, stable, and scalable way. As an emerging member of a software engineering team, you execute software solutions through the design, development, and technical troubleshooting of multiple components within a technical product, application, or system, while gaining the skills and experience needed to grow within your role.

Job responsibilities

  • Executes standard software solutions, design, development, and technical troubleshooting
  • Applies 6 core pillars of AWS architecture principles to build secure, high-performing, resilient and effective infrastructure for a variety of applications and workloads.
  • Designs, develops, codes, and troubleshoots with consideration of upstream and downstream systems and technical implications
  • Applies knowledge of tools within the Software Development Life Cycle toolchain to improve the value realized by automation
  • Applies technical troubleshooting to break down solutions and solve technical problems of basic complexity
  • Writes secure and high-quality code using the syntax of at least one programming language with limited guidance
  • Gathers, analyzes, and draws conclusions from large, diverse data sets to identify problems and contribute to decision-making in service of secure, stable application development
  • Learns and applies system processes, methodologies, and skills for the development of secure, stable code and systems
  • Adds to team culture of diversity, opportunity, inclusion, and respect

Required qualifications, capabilities, and skills

  • Formal training or certification on software engineering concepts and 2+ years applied experience
  • Hands-on practical experience in system design, application development, testing, and operational stability
  • Experience in developing, debugging, and maintaining code in a large corporate environment with one or more modern programming languages and database querying languages
  • Hands-on practical experience delivering system design, application development, testing, and operational stability within a cloud environment (AWS)
  • Practical cloud native experience in AWS
  • Experience in Java, Spring Boot, and Kubernetes (EKS, ECS) and hands-on experience in developing automation scripts using Python and Unix Shell Scripting
  • Demonstrated proficiency in software applications and technical processes within distributed cloud deployments and cloud native architectures
  • Hands-on experience in application development using EC2, S3, EMR, Lambda and provisioning AWS resources into multiple cloud accounts through automated pipeline using Terraform
  • Experience in the AWS platform monitoring tools like Cloudwatch or Datadog for monitoring the utilization and in setting up the thresholds and performance alerts.
  • Exposure to agile methodologies such as CI/CD, Application Resiliency, and Security
  • Emerging knowledge of software applications and technical processes within a technical discipline (e.g., cloud, artificial intelligence, machine learning, mobile, etc.)

Preferred qualifications, capabilities, and skills

  • In-depth knowledge of the financial services industry and their IT systems
  • Experience with chaos engineering concepts and tooling

ABOUT US


Chase is a leading financial services firm, helping nearly half of America’s households and small businesses achieve their financial goals through a broad range of financial products. Our mission is to create engaged, lifelong relationships and put our customers at the heart of everything we do. We also help small businesses, nonprofits and cities grow, delivering solutions to solve all their financial needs.

We offer a competitive total rewards package including base salary determined based on the role, experience, skill set and location. Those in eligible roles may receive commission-based pay and/or discretionary incentive compensation, paid in the form of cash and/or forfeitable equity, awarded in recognition of individual achievements and contributions. We also offer a range of benefits and programs to meet employee needs, based on eligibility. These benefits include comprehensive health care coverage, on-site health and wellness centers, a retirement savings plan, backup childcare, tuition reimbursement, mental health support, financial coaching and more. Additional details about total compensation and benefits will be provided during the hiring process.

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. We also make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs. Visit our FAQs for more information about requesting an accommodation.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veterans




ABOUT THE TEAM

Our Consumer & Community Banking division serves our Chase customers through a range of financial services, including personal banking, credit cards, mortgages, auto financing, investment advice, small business loans and payment processing. We’re proud to lead the U.S. in credit card sales and deposit growth and have the most-used digital solutions – all while ranking first in customer satisfaction.
company_description: Headquartered in New York City, JPMorgan Chase is the largest bank in the United States.

title: Senior Lead Software Engineer - Cloud Solution Engineer
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION


Be an integral part of an agile team that's constantly pushing the envelope to enhance, build, and deliver top-notch technology products.

As a Senior Lead Software Engineer and Solutions Engineer at JPMorgan Chase within the Consumer and Community Banking's Card Technology Team, you provide expertise to enhance and develop architecture platforms based on modern cloud-based technologies, as well as support the adoption of strategic global solutions. Leverage your advanced architecture capabilities and collaborate with colleagues across the organization to drive best-in-class outcomes.

As a Solutions Engineer for Card Technology, you will collaborate with different teams to understand their needs, architect solutions, and provide guidance throughout the implementation process and ensure that solutions are optimized for performance, security, reliability, availability, observability, and compliance. Your role will involve close collaboration with executives, product owners, and engineers, driving the development and ownership of technological architecture while leading solutions for platform advancement and modernization initiatives. Beyond having strong technical expertise, your capacity to foster collaboration and influence across diverse teams is crucial.

Job responsibilities

  • Regularly provides technical guidance and direction to support the business and its technical teams, contractors, and vendors
  • Develops secure and high-quality production code, and reviews and debugs code written by others
  • Drives decisions that influence the product design, application functionality, and technical operations and processes
  • Serves as a function-wide subject matter expert in one or more areas of focus
  • Actively contributes to the engineering community as an advocate of firmwide frameworks, tools, and practices of the Software Development Life Cycle
  • Influences peers and project decision-makers to consider the use and application of leading-edge technologies
  • Adds to the team culture of diversity, opportunity, inclusion, and respect

Required qualifications, capabilities, and skills

  • Formal training or certification on software engineering concepts and 5+ years applied experience
  • Experience with Cloud Technologies in particular Public Cloud and AWS.
  • Experience in crafting well-architected designs, application development, testing, resiliency and operational stability to utilize the capabilities of cloud computing for applications
  • Advanced knowledge in one or more software, applications, and architecture
  • Advanced knowledge of software architecture, application development, and technical processes with considerable in-depth knowledge in one or more technical disciplines (e.g., cloud, artificial intelligence, machine learning, mobile, etc.)
  • Experience applying expertise and new methods to determine solutions for complex architecture problems in one or more technical disciplines.
  • Experience in advanced design patterns in Java ,Python, Terraform and proficiency in SQL . NoSQL cloud databases.
  • Experience of building secure solution designs including cloud experience
  • Ability to tackle design and functionality problems independently with little to no oversight
  • Ability to evaluate current and emerging technologies recommend the best solutions for the future state architecture

  • Drive domain modeling, designing, and handling of complex and scalable architectures, building container eco-systems for micro services

Preferred qualifications, capabilities, and skills

  • Expertise in modernization in cloud platform from large, complex heritage ecosystem of mainframe and monoliths.
  • Experience in modeling languages like UML or C4 model and knowledge of EA frameworks like TOGAF is preferable
  • Experience with Micro-Services and Event-Driven architectures
ABOUT US


Chase is a leading financial services firm, helping nearly half of America’s households and small businesses achieve their financial goals through a broad range of financial products. Our mission is to create engaged, lifelong relationships and put our customers at the heart of everything we do. We also help small businesses, nonprofits and cities grow, delivering solutions to solve all their financial needs.

We offer a competitive total rewards package including base salary determined based on the role, experience, skill set and location. Those in eligible roles may receive commission-based pay and/or discretionary incentive compensation, paid in the form of cash and/or forfeitable equity, awarded in recognition of individual achievements and contributions. We also offer a range of benefits and programs to meet employee needs, based on eligibility. These benefits include comprehensive health care coverage, on-site health and wellness centers, a retirement savings plan, backup childcare, tuition reimbursement, mental health support, financial coaching and more. Additional details about total compensation and benefits will be provided during the hiring process.

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. We also make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs. Our Consumer & Community Banking division serves our Chase customers through a range of financial services, including personal banking, credit cards, mortgages, auto financing, investment advice, small business loans and payment processing. We’re proud to lead the U.S. in credit card sales and deposit growth and have the most-used digital solutions – all while ranking first in customer satisfaction.

title: DevOps Software Engineer III
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION


We have an exciting and rewarding opportunity for you to take your software engineering career to the next level.

As a DevOps Software Engineer III at JPMorgan Chase within the Corporate Technology Line of Business, you serve as a seasoned member of an agile team to design and deliver trusted market-leading technology products in a secure, stable, and scalable way. You will provide On-Prem and AWS Cloud Support with End-to-End Delivery Support. You are responsible for carrying out critical technology solutions across multiple technical areas within various business functions in support of the firm’s business objectives.

Our Corporate Technology team relies on smart, driven people like you to develop applications and provide tech support for all our corporate functions across our network. Your efforts will touch lives all over the financial spectrum and across all our divisions: Global Finance, Corporate Treasury, Risk Management, Human Resources, Compliance, Legal, and within the Corporate Administrative Office. You’ll be part of a team specifically built to meet and exceed our evolving technology needs, as well as our technology controls agenda.

Job responsibilities

  • Ensures critical Engineering automations that help keep cutting edge applications with strict real-time SLAs.
  • Develop applications and provide tech support for all our corporate functions across Corporate Sector Network.
  • Executes software solutions, design, development, and technical troubleshooting with ability to think beyond routine or conventional approaches to build solutions or break down technical problems
  • Creates secure and high-quality production code and maintains algorithms that run synchronously with appropriate systems
  • Produces architecture and design artifacts for complex applications while being accountable for ensuring design constraints are met by software code development
  • Gathers, analyzes, synthesizes, and develops visualizations and reporting from large, diverse data sets in service of continuous improvement of software applications and systems
  • Proactively identifies hidden problems and patterns in data and uses these insights to drive improvements to coding hygiene and system architecture
  • Contributes to software engineering communities of practice and events that explore new and emerging technologies
  • Adds to team culture of diversity, opportunity, inclusion, and respect

Required qualifications, capabilities, and skills

  • Formal training or certification on software engineering concepts and 3+ years applied experience.
  • Adept in Hadoop to diagnose and fix application issues. Concept and working experience in private cloud (i.e., enterprise specific cloud themes).
  • Experience in Orchestration (e.g., Autosys, Airflow, Control-M, Oozie, etc.). Control-M experience is mandatory.
  • Mandatory - Database exposure and intermediate level SQL skills to be able to query and manage Oracle, Aurora etc.
  • Hands on expertise in AWS Services and Tools – esp. Athena, RDS/Aurora, Redshift, EMR, EC2, S3, Lambda.
  • Experience working with Third Party Vendor Data Management Systems and resolving Trouble Tickets using DevOps Process.
  • Hands-on practical experience in system design, application development, testing, and operational stability
  • Proficient in coding in one or more languages i.e. Java, Scala, Python, Shell Scripts
  • Experience in developing, debugging, and maintaining code in a large corporate environment with one or more modern programming languages and database querying languages
  • Experience in logging changes in Incident Management system and effectively Communication/Coordination with Stakeholders
  • Demonstrated knowledge of software applications and technical processes within a technical discipline (e.g., cloud, artificial intelligence, machine learning, mobile, etc.)

Preferred qualifications, capabilities, and skills

  • Experience with database technologies – Oracle/MySQL.
  • Familiar with development tools such as IntelliJ, Bitbucket, Sql Developer/Toad, JIRA, Jules, Jenkins.
  • Familiarity with Hbase, Spark-shell, Hive, etc. can be an added Plus.
    • Experience with big data stack
  • - Spark, Hadoop, Hive, Hbase, Impala, Kafka, Cloudera/Hortonworks is a big plus
  • Knowledge of building Rest API (microservices) with Spring, Spring boot (or Python) is a plus.
  • Spinnaker, Jenkins, Terraform and similar SDLC and Monitoring Tools (Cloud Watch, Dynatrace is a plus).
  • Observability – Use of Splunk and/or Grafana hands on.

ABOUT US
JPMorganChase, one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world’s most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.

We offer a competitive total rewards package including base salary determined based on the role, experience, skill set and location. Those in eligible roles may receive commission-based pay and/or discretionary incentive compensation, paid in the form of cash and/or forfeitable equity, awarded in recognition of individual achievements and contributions. We also offer a range of benefits and programs to meet employee needs, based on eligibility. These benefits include comprehensive health care coverage, on-site health and wellness centers, a retirement savings plan, backup childcare, tuition reimbursement, mental health support, financial coaching and more. Additional details about total compensation and benefits will be provided during the hiring process.

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. We also make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs. Visit our FAQs for more information about requesting an accommodation.

JPMorgan Chase & Co. is an Equal Opportunity Employer, including Disability/Veterans




ABOUT THE TEAM

Our professionals in our Corporate Functions cover a diverse range of areas from finance and risk to human resources and marketing. Our corporate teams are an essential part of our company, ensuring that we’re setting our businesses, clients, customers and employees up for success.

title: Network Management System Software Engineer / Architect
description:
Microwave Networks is seeking a highly motivated and technically skilled Software Engineer or Architect to define, architect, and oversee the development of a Network Management System (NMS) designed to monitor, control, and optimize microwave radio networks. This role combines software engineering, networking, and systems thinking—with opportunities to shape a modern platform that uses machine learning and data analytics for intelligent network operations.

Key Responsibilities:

  • System Architecture & Design
  • Define system-level architecture and functional requirements for an NMS that manages microwave radio networks, including fault, configuration, accounting, performance, and security (FCAPS) functions.
  • Develop detailed technical specifications, interface definitions, and data models for managing microwave radios and related network elements.
  • Integrate AI and analytics capabilities for predictive maintenance, root cause analysis, and performance optimization.
  • Ensure scalability, reliability, and security in system design to support large network deployments.
  • Technical Leadership
  • Lead and mentor a team of software engineers, providing technical direction and guidance throughout the development lifecycle.
  • Coordinate across hardware, firmware, and software development teams to ensure seamless integration with radio systems.
  • Conduct design and code reviews to ensure adherence to best practices and standards.
  • Project Management
  • Collaborate with project managers to define project scope, milestones, and deliverables.
  • Track progress, identify risks, and implement mitigation strategies to ensure timely delivery.
  • Interface with internal stakeholders and customers to gather requirements and demonstrate progress.
  • Software Development Oversight
  • Oversee implementation of network monitoring, alarm correlation, root cause analysis, and performance analytics modules.
  • Define APIs and communication protocols (e.g., SNMP, NETCONF/YANG, REST) for integration with microwave radios and third-party systems.
  • Guide the development of data visualization dashboards and user interfaces for network operators.
  • Testing & Validation
  • Define and oversee system integration testing, acceptance testing, and performance validation.
  • Ensure the NMS meets reliability, latency, and throughput requirements under real-world network conditions.

Qualifications:

  • Education:

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related field.

  • Experience:
  • 5+ years of experience in network systems engineering or software development for telecommunications systems.
  • Proven experience in leading software engineering teams and delivering complex network management or OSS/BSS solutions.
  • Strong understanding of microwave radio systems, network protocols, and IP-based communications.
  • Experience with AI/ML applications (anomaly detection, performance forecasting, or root cause analysis).
  • Technical Skills:
  • Deep knowledge of SNMP, NETCONF/YANG, REST APIs, and related network management protocols.
  • Familiarity with FCAPS management and ITU-T/TMN standards.
  • Experience with modern software stacks (e.g., Python, Java, C++, or Go), cloud-native architectures, and database systems (SQL/NoSQL).
  • Understanding of data analytics, machine learning for performance prediction, and root cause analysis is a plus.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $100,000.00 per year

Education:

  • Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

  • Network Systems Engineering: 5 years (Required)
  • Software design: 5 years (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Data Engineer
description:
Company Description


Eurofins Scientific is an international life sciences company, providing a unique range of analytical testing services to clients across multiple industries, to make life and our environment safer, healthier and more sustainable. From the food you eat, to the water you drink, to the medicines you rely on, Eurofins laboratories work with the biggest companies in the world to ensure the products they supply are safe, their ingredients are authentic, and labelling is accurate.

Eurofins is dedicated to delivering testing services that contribute to the health and safety of society and the planet, and to its corporate responsibility to protect the environment and ensure diversity, equity, and inclusion across the entire network of Eurofins companies.


Job Description


Our team is at the forefront of applying Machine Learning (ML) to interpret and process complex chemical data, specifically chromatograms and environmental testing results. We're seeking a skilled Data Engineer to design, build, and maintain the robust data pipelines and infrastructure necessary to support our ML model training, deployment, and analysis workflows. The ideal candidate has a strong foundation in data engineering, understands the unique challenges of scientific data, and is eager to work closely with both Machine Learning Engineers (MLE) and Chemists.

Key Responsibilities

  • Data Pipeline Development: Design, construct, and manage scalable and reliable ETL/ELT pipelines to ingest, clean, transform, and store raw chemistry data (e.g., CSV, JSON, and proprietary instrument formats).
  • Data Modeling & Warehousing: Develop optimized data models and manage a data warehouse (or data lake) to support fast querying and ML feature engineering on complex datasets, including time-series and spectral data from chromatograms.
  • ML Infrastructure: Collaborate with MLE to containerize and deploy ML models and build automated model retraining and monitoring pipelines.
  • Data Quality & Governance: Implement robust data quality checks, validation, and monitoring to ensure the integrity and reproducibility of chemical experiment data used for ML.
  • Tooling: Develop internal tools and APIs to facilitate data access for MLE and provide standardized interfaces for data submission from chemistry lab systems.


Qualifications


Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, or a related technical field (or equivalent practical experience)

Required Experience:

  • Programming: Expert-level proficiency in Python (including packages like Pandas, NumPy, and familiarity with data engineering libraries).
  • Cloud & Infrastructure: Hands-on experience with at least one major cloud provider (AWS, Azure, or GCP, preferred Azure), including services related to computing, storage, and serverless functions (e.g., Azure Data Lake Storage (ADLS), Azure Compute VMs, Azure Functions).
  • Data Orchestration: Proven experience building and managing data workflows using an orchestration tool like Apache Airflow, Prefect, or Dagster.
  • Databases: Strong knowledge of SQL and experience working with both relational (e.g., PostgreSQL) and NoSQL databases.
  • Version Control: Proficient with Git and standard DevOps practices
  • Scientific Data Experience: Prior experience handling and processing complex, large-volume scientific data (e.g., mass spectrometry, chromatography, LIMS/ELN integration).
  • MLOps: Familiarity with MLOps platforms and tools such as Azure ML Studio, MLflow, Kubeflow, or Sagemaker.
  • Chemistry Domain: Basic understanding of analytical chemistry concepts, such as chromatography fundamentals (e.g., retention time, peak integration) and relevant file formats.
  • Authorization to work in the United States without restriction or sponsorship
  • Professional working proficiency in English is a requirement, including the ability to read, write and speak in English.

Required General Skills

  • Problem-Solving: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a focus on delivering high-quality, reproducible data solutions.
  • Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to bridge the gap between technical infrastructure, data science models, and chemical applications.

Additional Information


Professional working proficiency in English is a requirement, including the ability to read, write and speak in English.

As a Eurofins employee, you will become part of a company that has received national recognition as a great place to work. We offer excellent full-time benefits including comprehensive medical coverage, life and disability insurance, 401(k) with company match, paid holidays, paid time off, and dental and vision options.

We support your development! Do you feel you don’t match 100% of the requirements? Don’t hesitate to apply anyway! Eurofins companies are committed to supporting your career development.

We embrace diversity! Eurofins network of companies believe in strength and innovation through diversity, being an Equal Opportunity Employer. We prohibit discrimination against employees or applications based on gender identity and/or expression, race, nationality, age, religion, sexual orientation, disability, and everything else that makes employees of Eurofins companies unique.

Sustainability matters to us! We are well on our way to achieving our objective of carbon neutrality by 2025, through a combination of emission reduction and compensation initiatives. We encourage our laboratory leaders to make sustainable changes at their local level, and in addition to their initiatives we also count on our dedicated carbon reduction team to help us to achieve this goal!

Find out more in our career page: https://careers.eurofins.com/

Eurofins USA Environment Testing is a Disabled and Veteran Equal Employment Opportunity employer.

title: Director of Artificial Intelligence (AI) - Remote
description:
Company Description


Vericast is the financial institution (FI) performance partner. We help banks and credit unions drive growth, improve efficiency, increase engagement and navigate change through the power of data, technology and people. Our advanced analytics, data-driven insights and integrated solution set enable better execution with agility, precision and scale. That’s why thousands of financial institutions look to Vericast and our 150 years of financial services expertise to help them achieve more.


Job Description


The Director of Artificial Intelligence (AI) is a senior leadership role responsible for developing and executing the organization’s AI vision and strategy. This individual will oversee the design, deployment, and management of AI solutions across the enterprise, ensuring alignment with business objectives, ethical standards, and technological best practices. The Director will lead cross-functional teams, collaborate with stakeholders, and drive innovation in the field of AI to deliver impactful and scalable results.

KEY DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES
 Lead the design, development, and deployment of AI and machine learning solutions to optimize business processes and enhance products and services (30%)
 Build, mentor, and manage a high-performing team of AI engineers, ML Ops Engineers, and Researchers (20%)
 Collaborate in developing and implementing the overall AI strategy, roadmap, and governance for the organization (10%)
 Collaborate with executive leadership and business units to identify opportunities for AI-driven innovation and efficiency (10%)
 Oversee the selection and integration of AI technologies and platforms, ensuring scalability, reliability, and security (10%)
 Help establish ethical guidelines and best practices for responsible AI development and deployment (5%)
 Monitor emerging trends, technologies, and regulatory developments in AI and assess their impact on the organization (5%)
 Manage partnerships with academic institutions, industry leaders, and technology vendors to advance the organization’s AI capabilities (5%)
 Drive thought leadership through presentations, publications, and participation in industry forums
(5%)


Qualifications


EDUCATION
 Bachelor's Degree (Required). MS degree preferred.
 Degree in a technical or numerical field with 5+ years of experience in Banking, FinTech or
Marketing.


EXPERIENCE
 15+ years’ experience designing and developing various Applications and/or Data Engineering
pipelines.
 5+ years’ experience in leading Data engineers and App Developers and building Financial Services
Solutions in big data infrastructure.
 Experience in LangGraph, LangChain, RAG Chatbots, Vector Databases, NLP-based automation,
MCP Server Development, Embedding-based Search, LLM Integration is required.
 Experience in Microservices Architecture, Kubernetes, OpenShift, AWS and/or Azure, Spring Boot,
Node.js, CI/CD, DevOps Automation, Cloud-Native Design is required.
 Experience using Trino, Superset, Starburst SQL Server, ETL Tools, S3, Airflow, Iceberg,
PySpark, Hive preferred.
 Publications or patents in AI-related areas preferred.
 Experience in Data Modeling, DB capacity/growth planning and SQL performance tuning.
 Experience working in a global or multi-site environment.


KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS/ABILITIES
 Strong track record of developing and deploying AI solutions in a business setting. Expertise in
machine learning frameworks, big data analytics, and cloud computing platforms.
 Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.
 Proven ability to manage complex projects and cross-functional teams.
 In-depth understanding of AI ethics, privacy, and regulatory considerations.
 Experience with budget management, vendor negotiations, and strategic planning.

COMMUNICATION AND CONTACTS
 This position works closely with IT and marketing counterparts (e.g. Managers and Directors of
Solutions and Strategy Director of Product Marketing and team members with the Client
Management and Operations divisions). This position collaborates closely with internal leadership
(VP’s and SVP’s in Technology and Marketing Solutions), stakeholders and external clients/vendors.
S/He will also work closely with Sales to ensure that Marketing Solutions capabilities are
understood and accurately and frequently communicated.


DECISION MAKING
  • Responsible for managing a team of AI/ML Engineers and Contractors, to execute multiple AI, ML
projects concurrently. Use judgment to identify, prioritize, structure, and solve complex business problems.

Additional Information


Base salary: $175,000-$200,000

Position is eligible for an annual bonus incentive program.

*Applications will be accepted through January 4, 2026, after which the posting will be closed and no longer available for submissions.*

The ultimate compensation offered for the position will depend upon several factors such as skill level, cost of living, experience, and responsibilities.

At Vericast, we don’t just accept differences - we celebrate them, we support them, and we thrive on them for the benefit of our employees, our clients, and our community. As an Equal Opportunity employer, Vericast considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin or ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status, or any other classifications protected by law. Applicants who have disabilities may request that accommodations be made in order to complete the selection process by contacting our Talent Acquisition team at talentacquisition@vericast.com. EEO is the law. To review your rights under Equal Employment Opportunity please visit: www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf.

title: Machine Learning Engineer - Automated Chromatography Analysis
description:
Company Description


Eurofins Scientific is an international life sciences company, providing a unique range of analytical testing services to clients across multiple industries, to make life and our environment safer, healthier and more sustainable. From the food you eat, to the water you drink, to the medicines you rely on, Eurofins laboratories work with the biggest companies in the world to ensure the products they supply are safe, their ingredients are authentic, and labelling is accurate.

You will design and deploy Machine Learning solutions for GC-MS, and HPLC-MS, data, working alongside scientists and engineers to extract valuable insights from complex datasets.

  • Build software solutions to automate chemical data analysis and interpretation

  • Strong programming skills in Python (Pandas, Scikit-learn, PyTorch, TensorFlow)

  • Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD for scalable Machine Learning deployment

title: Enterprise Web Developer
company: University of Texas at El Paso
description:
Summary: Under limited supervision, designs, develops, and deploys web-based applications that enhance university operations. This role offers hands-on experience in both artificial intelligence and enterprise web development, working under the guidance of senior developers and architects. The position contributes to projects to automate processes, improve user experience, and support data-driven decision making across University departments.

Note: The primary accountabilities below are intended to describe the general content of and requirements of this position and are not intended to be an exhaustive statement of duties. Incumbents may perform all or some of the primary accountabilities listed below. Specific tasks or responsibilities will be documented in the incumbents’ performance objectives as outlined by the incumbents’ immediate supervisor or manager. This position is security-sensitive and subject to Texas Education Code §51.215, which authorizes the employer to obtain criminal history record information. Must possess a valid driver’s license issued by the State where the applicant resides and must be insurable as defined in the UT System UTS 157, as applicable to the performance of essential duties and responsibilities of the position.

Statement of Duties and Responsibilities:


Assist in developing and maintaining web-based applications using 3-Tier architecture.

Support the design and implementation of AI models and algorithms for business applications.

Use AI in the design, creation and evaluation of business applications and processes.

Help collect, clean, and prepare datasets for machine learning tasks.

Participate in testing and optimizing AI and web solutions for performance and usability.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams including data scientists, software engineers, and business stakeholders.

Use source control and issue tracking tools (e.g., Git, JIRA).

Follow design specifications and usability principles in application development

Stay current with trends in AI, web development, and software engineering.

Assist in code reviews and contribute to documentation and prototypes.

Support projects through the full software development life-cycle (SDLC).

Assists in the implementation of complex off-the-shelf components or applicationsrequiring development.

Develops solutions based on functionality requirements which are technical strategies that enable e-business solutions in support of the University's business functions.

Implements usability design principles.

Works with the Database Administrators and the Web Solutions Architect on the design, development, testing, and implementation of custom applications.

Follows applicable software development processes, polices, procedures, and coding standards.

Identifies system deficiencies and works with Senior Web Developer and Web Solutions Architect to identify the solutions.

Works to meet all development deadlines and schedules while consistently delivering high-quality products; prioritizes and executes multiple tasks effectively.

Proactively initiates, develops, and maintains effective working relationships with team members; follows through with commitments and fosters mutual trust with fellow employees; cooperates with a variety of people and achieves results.

Proactively seeks opportunities to broaden and deepen knowledge base and proficiencies; shares acquired skills with team members through formal and informal channels; works with team members to make innovative contributions and promotes the embrace of new ideas.

Stays abreast of industry trends and all applicable technologies, including scripting, security issues, authoring tools, and new languages in order to broaden and expand knowledge base and proficiencies.

Assists with special projects and new technology deployments.

Knowledge of all Microsoft Office software and able to learn and use institutional software systems.

Complies with all State and University policies.

Other duties may be assigned

Supervisory Responsibilities: No supervisory responsibilities.

Qualifications


Qualifications: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Required Qualifications:

Education: Bachelor's degree or Equivalent Combination of Education and Experience in related area.

and

Experience: Bachelor's degree or Equivalent Combination of Education and Experience in the related area.


Preferred Qualifications: Two years in software development using C#/.NET, Python, JavaScript, or similar. One year of incorporating AI technologies (Gen AI, Agentic AI) into solutions.

Additional Information


Physical Demands: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to feel and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to walk. The employee must occasionally lift and move up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision and ability to adjust focus.

Work Environment: The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

title: Platform Architect Manager
description:
We are looking for a seasoned Platform Architect Manager to lead and scale our cloud infrastructure and data operations. This role requires a strategic thinker with hands-on experience in AWS and Azure, and a strong background in CI/CD, infrastructure automation, and team leadership. You will manage cross-functional teams of data engineers, data scientists, and cloud architects, driving operational excellence and innovation across our data and cloud platforms.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Lead and mentor a multidisciplinary team of DevOps engineers, data engineers, data scientists, and cloud architects.

  • Architect and implement scalable CI/CD pipelines for data and machine learning workflows.

  • Oversee cloud infrastructure management across AWS and Azure, ensuring high availability, security, and cost-efficiency.

  • Collaborate with engineering and data teams to streamline deployment processes and automate infrastructure provisioning using tools like Terraform, CloudFormation, and ARM templates.

  • Drive adoption of DevOps best practices including monitoring, logging, incident response, and performance optimization.

  • Manage version control, release management, and environment consistency across development, staging, and production.

  • Ensure compliance with data governance, security policies, and regulatory requirements.

  • Evaluate and integrate new tools and technologies to improve operational workflows and team productivity.


Required Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.

  • 7+ years of experience in DevOps or cloud infrastructure roles, with 3+ years in a leadership or managerial capacity.

  • Proficient in leveraging Databricks for both traditional machine learning workflows and the development of custom models. Experienced in fine-tuning large language models (LLMs) to establish a scalable and resilient foundation for advanced AI-driven data modeling.

  • Proven experience with AWS and Azure cloud platforms.

  • Strong knowledge of CI/CD tools such as Jenkins, GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, or Azure DevOps.

  • Proficiency in scripting languages (e.g., Python, Bash, PowerShell) and infrastructure-as-code.

  • Experience managing data-centric environments, including support for data pipelines, ML models, and analytics platforms.

  • Familiarity with containerization and orchestration tools like Docker and Kubernetes.


Preferred Qualifications:

  • Certifications such as AWS Certified DevOps Engineer, Azure DevOps Engineer Expert, or similar.

  • Experience with ML Ops, data lake architectures, and real-time data streaming.

  • Knowledge of security frameworks and compliance standards (e.g., SOC 2, HIPAA, GDPR).

  • Background in Agile/Scrum methodologies and project management tools like Jira or Asana.


Soft Skills:

  • Strong leadership and team-building capabilities.

  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management.

  • Strategic mindset with a hands-on approach to problem-solving.

  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, evolving environment.

What’s In It for You?

You will be joining a high profile team and a great company known for its Servant Leadership and “work hard, play harder” culture. Competitive compensation package includes base salary plus annual cash bonus and equity grant (restricted share units) eligibility.

We also offer excellent family benefits including: medical, dental, vision, flexible spending account, long term and short term disability, life insurance, 401(k) retirement and unlimited opportunities to "Connect with Your Future."

Waste Connections is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to disability or protected veteran status.
company_description: We are Waste Connections, an integrated services company that provides solid waste collection, transfer, disposal and recycling services to local residents and businesses throughout the U.S. & Canada.

title: Data Engineer - AI Focused
description:
Overview:
Job Title: Senior Data Engineer
Location: Remote (Must be located in Central or Eastern time zone)
Department: Information Technology
Reports To: Data & Analytics Director

Job Overview
We are growing our data capabilities and are looking for a Senior Data Engineer to help us build the next stage of our analytics and AI journey. You’ll join a small, collaborative team that already has strengths in database operations, business intelligence, and stakeholder engagement. What we need now is someone who can bring in deeper data engineering expertise and applied AI/ML experience—and help guide us into what’s possible.
This is a hands-on role where you will work across the full data lifecycle—ingesting, transforming, modeling, enriching, and applying advanced analytics. You’ll help us navigate and adopt the rapidly evolving Microsoft Fabric and Azure AI ecosystem. We are early in our AI/ML journey, and you will play a key role in shaping and growing these capabilities alongside the rest of the team. If you’re excited to build practical, meaningful data solutions and explore real AI/ML opportunities in a collaborative environment, this is the place for you.
Responsibilities:
Key Responsibilities
Data Engineering & Integration
  • Own and build end-to-end data pipelines within Microsoft Fabric.
  • Ingest and transform data from:
    • ERP systems (e.g., Business Central using SQL, APIs, or OData)
    • CRM/SaaS systems (Salesforce, Dayforce, etc.)
    • File-based sources (CSV, JSON, Excel, cloud storage, SFTP, etc.)
  • Deliver reliable, validated, well-structured datasets for analytics and operational needs.
  • Keep pipelines lean, maintainable, and aligned with team capacity.

Data Modeling & Transformation
  • Build clear, analytics-ready datasets inside Fabric Lakehouse/Warehouse architecture.
  • Utilize SQL, Python, and Spark to normalize, join, enrich, and clean data.
  • Design modeling patterns that fit our team and business—simple, transparent, and scalable.

Applied AI/ML
  • Bring real-world experience applying AI/ML techniques and understanding the landscape of available approaches.
  • Prepare training datasets, run models, evaluate outcomes, and integrate results back into pipelines and analytics products.
  • Apply ML and AI techniques to use cases such as:
    • Process automation assisted by generative AI
    • Forecasting and predictive modeling
    • Classification or enrichment of structured/semi-structured data
    • Extraction and enrichment of unstructured data (text, documents, etc.)
  • Use Fabric, Azure Foundry and other AI/ML capabilities in practical, value-driven ways.
  • Help the team explore new AI/ML opportunities as you learn our business and data, your ideas will shape our direction.

Quality, Reliability & Maintainability
  • Implement testing, validation, error handling, and monitoring across pipelines and models.
  • Use Git and CI/CD practices appropriate to our environment.
  • Keep solutions simple, maintainable, and well-documented.

Cross-Team Collaboration & Iterative Workstyle
  • Work with teammates focused on BI, database engineering, and business analysis to deliver complete data solutions.
  • Participate in defining requirements, validating outputs and troubleshooting issues.
  • Work in a light Agile environment, using tools like Jira for backlog management, sprint planning, and tracking work progress.
  • Help break down complex initiatives into manageable increments that deliver value continually.

Continuous Learning & Evolution
  • Stay current with Microsoft Fabric and Azure AI advancements.
  • Proactively propose improvements, new approaches, and opportunities.
  • Grow your expertise and ownership of our AI/ML capabilities over time.
Qualifications:
Qualifications and Skills
  • Education and Experience:
    • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Data Science, or a related field or equivalent professional experience.
    • 3–7+ years of hands-on experience in data engineering, analytics engineering, or applied machine learning.
      • Relevant certifications (Microsoft, Azure, Fabric, AI/ML) or advanced degrees are a plus but not required.
  • Skills and Technical Experience:
    • Deep experience with SQL and Python for data ingestion, transformation, and integration.
    • Experience with Microsoft Fabric or Azure data ecosystem tools (Data Factory, Synapse, ADLS, Databricks).
    • Proven ability to extract, transform, and model data from ERPs, SaaS systems, APIs, and file-based sources.
    • Familiarity with Spark for larger-scale transformations.
    • Experience applying AI/ML techniques in real-world scenarios (regression, forecasting, classification, NLP, enrichment, etc.).
    • Ability to work autonomously and collaborate within a small, multi-disciplinary team.
      • Experience working in iterative frameworks (Agile, Scrum, or similar) using Jira or equivalent tools.
  • Additional Experience (Helpful, not required):
    • Experience with Business Central or similar ERP systems.
    • Exposure to Power BI semantic modeling concepts.
    • Experience deploying or operationalizing ML models.
    • Familiarity with Azure AI, Copilot, or LLM-based enrichment.


EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER | DRUG-FREE WORKPLACE
Shermco is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or veteran status. Shermco is a drug-free workplace.
NO AGENCIES PLEASE

Pay Range: USD $115,000.00 - USD $140,000.00 /Yr.

title: Maintenance Engineer
description:
We are building a team of trailblazers, who embody growth, impact, and excellence.

Job Description

Pinnacle is committed to building future leaders through a dedicated career program where you are in control of your own professional journey. Whether you are interested in project management, solving critical problems, or working directly with the customer to understand their specific needs, we have the resources and opportunities to help you reach your goals.

Pinnacle is focused on helping industrial facilities improve reliability performance, resulting in increased production, optimized spending, and improved process safety and environmental impact. We bridge the gap between data and reliability decisions by combining reliability engineering expertise with data science and technology. Pinnacle serves a variety of industries, including:
  • Oil & Gas
  • Food & Beverage
  • Specialty & Petrochemical
  • Pharmaceutical
  • Mining
  • Agriculture & Fertilizer
  • Lumber
  • Water & Wastewater

The Pinnacle Way is our framework for ensuring that each of our teams operates with excellence while we consistently meet customer needs and provide a world-class experience.
Why Advance Your Career at Pinnacle?
Career Growth: Pinnacle supports professional development with comprehensive onboarding, training, and leadership programs. Whether you are interested in project management, solving critical problems, or working directly with the customer, we have the resources and opportunities to help you achieve your goals.

Innovative Culture: We embrace curiosity, engagement, and a commitment to excellence in everything we do. Pinnacle is where reliability meets innovation, constantly exploring ways to redefine reliability in industries like Oil & Gas, Food & Beverage, Pharmaceutical, Mining, and more.

Work Environment: A collaborative, supportive work culture with strong team dynamics, open access to leadership, and fun workplace perks like quarterly fellowship events, family gatherings, a free premium coffee bar, and an on-site gym.

The Impact of a Maintenance Engineer
A proactive maintenance engineer driving refinery reliability, safety, and profitability by anticipating problems before they occur, eliminating recurring failures, and turning maintenance from a reactive cost into a strategic advantage. Taking actions to minimize downtime, extend asset life, and strengthen the partnership between operations, maintenance, and engineering

Your Job Responsibilities:

  • Drive asset improvement in areas of safety, environmental, reliability and process capacity
  • Identify and develop recommendations for changes and projects to improve unit operation.
  • Participate in and eventually lead root cause analyses (RCA) for mechanical and process equipment failures.
  • Assist in maintaining and improving PM/PdM programs, with increasing responsibility over time.
  • Support and progressively take ownership of reliability strategy for critical assets (pumps, exchangers, vessels, piping, compressors).
  • Optimize spare parts inventory and maintenance planning processes.
  • Coordinate with operations to schedule and execute maintenance activities.
  • Support turnaround planning and project scope development.
  • Track and improve reliability KPIs (MTBF, MTTR, PM compliance).
  • Drive bad actor elimination and reliability improvement initiatives.
  • Champion use of CMMS, data analytics, and digital reliability tools.

Accountabilities:

Improved equipment reliability ( MTBF,
  • unplanned downtime).
  • Increased proactive work (% PM/PdM vs reactive maintenance).
  • Controlled maintenance cost per asset or per barrel.
  • Reduction in repeat failures and recurrence of known issues.
  • Compliance with safety, environmental, and mechanical integrity standards.
  • Implementation and closure of reliability or cost improvement actions.
  • Effective collaboration with operations, inspection, and project teams.

Required Qualifications:

  • B.S. in Mechanical Engineering/Mechanical Engineering Technology/Reliability
  • 2–5 years of industrial maintenance, reliability, or engineering experience — OR equivalent hands-on maintenance craft experience with strong technical aptitude and a desire to grow into an engineering role
  • Open to early-career engineers with co-op/internship experience and high learning agility

  • Path A – Engineering Track

  • Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering, MET, Reliability, or related discipline
  • Internship/co-op or 1–3+ years' experience in maintenance, operations, turnaround, or reliability

  • Path B – Maintenance Craft / Technician Track

  • 5+ years industrial maintenance or rotating equipment experience
  • Demonstrated troubleshooting ability and willingness to develop engineering-level analytical skills
  • Experience with pumps, compressors, or fixed equipment is a strong plus

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Certified Maintenance & Reliability Professional (CMRP) or Certified Reliability Engineer (CRE).
  • Working knowledge of API 510/570/653, ASME codes, and reliability tools (RCM, FMEA, RCA).
  • Familiarity with risk-based inspection (RBI) and fitness-for-service (FFS) assessments.
  • Proficiency with data visualization or analytics tools (Power BI, Spotfire, Excel).
  • Proficiency in CMMS (SAP, Maximo, etc.) and maintenance planning systems.
  • Experience using condition monitoring and predictive maintenance technologies.
  • Strong communication, leadership, and problem-solving skills.
  • Training available for candidates with the right mindset and mechanical aptitude.

Benefits:

The Complete You

  • Health, vision, and dental insurance, life insurance, 401(k) matching, paid time off (PTO), nine paid holidays, 8 hours of volunteer paid time off (VPTO), and maternity and parental leave.

Campus Perks (while visiting or working from the Pasadena office)

  • Onsite gym with full amenities, walking workstations, free parking, mini mart/snack machines, gourmet coffee machines, multiple indoor and outdoor collaboration areas, huddle rooms, deep workspaces, and lactation facilities.

Company Celebrations

  • Quarterly town hall and fellowships, length of service awards where employees receive additional paid time off and bonuses to cover travel expenses for anniversary milestone trips (5, 10, and 15 years).

Empowering You for Success

  • Opportunity to participate in customer-focused project management groups (PODs) that help facilitate collaboration and project support, access to company technology stack of Microsoft Office 365 Suite and MS Teams, comprehensive onboarding, on-demand training, regular lunch and learns, supervisor and accountability training, leadership development programs, continuous learning opportunities, and more.

About Pinnacle:

Headquartered in Pasadena, Texas, Pinnacle is focused on helping industrial facilities improve reliability performance, resulting in increased production, optimized spend, and improved process safety and environmental impact. Pinnacle bridges the gap between data and reliability decisions by combining reliability engineering expertise with data science and technology. Pinnacle is privately held and has been consistently recognized for its growth by Inc. Magazine, the Houston Business Journal, and more.

Working Environment

  • Conditions may include working inside and/or outside. Prepare site, materials, and tools. Loading, unloading, assembly and disassembly of materials, tools, and equipment. May work in office environment or in plant around machinery with moving parts and moving objects. Working near radiant and electrical energy. Working closely with others or working alone. Working at height, including drops below ground level. Working extended or irregular hours and travelling by all possible modes of transportation. May work in conjunction with customer representatives, inspectors, and other contractors.

Physical Job Requirements

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is:

  • Frequently required to stand; use hands to grasp, handle or feel, reach with hands and arms; and climb, balance, stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl in an outdoor environment.
  • Occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds.
  • Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.
  • May be required to work flexible work hours; on-call duty, plant outages.

Tools and PPE Requirements

  • Equipment (machines, tools, devices) used in performing the essential job function include but not limited to computer and related equipment, calculator, special instrumentation, hand tools, power tools, air tools, telephone, and automobile. Ability to wear proper personal protective equipment (PPE), including but not limited to, safety glasses, hardhat, reinforced toed shoes, coveralls, gloves, and ear plugs or muffs. Must abide by safety guidelines and regulations.

Limitations and Disclaimer

This job description describes the general job duties, accountabilities and physical requirements associates with the position; it is not an exhaustive list of all the duties, accountabilities, or skills required for the position.

The general job duties, accountabilities and physical requirements associated with the position are subject to modification to reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities. Some physical requirements may exclude individuals who pose a threat or risk to the health or safety to themselves or others.

This job description neither states nor implies that the listed general job duties, accountabilities, and physical requirements associated with the position are the only tasks expected of an employee. An employee is also required to follow any other job-related instructions and perform any other job-related tasks requested by their supervisor and not in violation of any applicable laws, regulations, or rules.

Requirements are representative of minimum levels of knowledge, skills, and abilities. To perform this job successfully, an employee must possess the abilities and aptitude to perform each duty, accountability, and physical requirement proficiently.

Visa Sponsorship: Employment eligibility to work with Pinnacle in the U.S. is required. This employer will not sponsor any applicants for the following work visa in this job category: H-1B - Cap Subject (Change of Status or Consular Notification). Note that an H-1B Change of Employer is generally not considered to be Cap Subject.

Pinnacle participates in E-Verify, a federal government system used to verify employment authorization and social security number of each new employee.

Pinnacle is an equal employment opportunity employer and does not discriminate based on race, color, national origin, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, sex, age, disability, veteran or military status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

title: Product Engineer
description:
Product, Technology Development and Program Management [70%]

  • The Product Development of new TE cooler-based Systems which are conceived, proposed, and promoted in support of Coherent strategic technical objectives, is done on schedule and on budget.
  • Evolutionary and revolutionary products and processes are lead and managed, that support customer requirements and Coherent strategic technical and sales objectives.
  • Program management of customer funded development projects. Includes leading/organizing cross-functional teams to support deliverables and schedules.
  • Perform product costing analysis.
  • Internal modeling/design capabilities are clearly understood including the bounds and limitations of use. Includes the ability to model/design thermoelectric modules using both internal custom software and Ansys Mechanical (both steady-state and transient operation).
  • New, complex heat exchanger product design concepts that provide innovative design solutions are created and analyzed
  • New manufacturing processes and materials as alternative to standard machining of aluminum and copper are conceived and researched.
  • Application tools (spreadsheets, MathCAD, IcePak, ANSYS, etc.) are developed and utilized, creating value and optimized solutions.
  • Modeling/designing/optimizing thermoelectric systems (cold plates/TEC/Heat sink sub-assemblies) with pertinent CFD packages (Fluent, Qfin).
  • Support internal development programs that integrate advanced data analytics, AI and machine learning into CTS proprietary TE design software. This includes creating custom Python code to support integration and implementation efforts.
  • Phase Gate and QRB processes are effectively utilized to transition new products and processes into engineering and manufacturing organizations.
  • Manufacturing design guidelines are understood, actively reviewed and improvements proposed.
  • Work group is represented in special problem-solving sessions addressing complex problems.
  • On-floor manufacturing support of assigned system product builds as needed.
  • Develop test protocols for TE systems as needed in support of qualification, reliability, and performance testing.
  • Perform and oversee hands-on experiments and performance testing in laboratory environment in support of assigned programs.
  • Interact with CTS global Vietnam manufacturing team to transition projects to manufacturing. Includes participation in weekly, evening conference calls with the CTS Vietnam production and R&D teams as needed.
  • Travel to customer sites and Coherent overseas factories to support program and organizational goals.
  • Lead R&D initiatives as needed in support of new products and processes.

Business Operations/Product Sales [10%]

  • Portray a positive image of Coherent to co-workers, external customers, and the public.
  • Externally and internally funded research and/or development program proposals consistent with the company technical direction are supported through the management and successful completion of identified tasks and assigned proposal sections are written.
  • Viewed as a lead technical interface for external customers.
  • Recognized as a primary design consultant for new product designs or for a particular aspect of technology important to Coherent.
  • The appropriate use of TE technology, at the TE cooler level and at the System level, is applied to product development projects.
  • Warranty or Quality Returns are analyzed using 8D, 5-Why, Fishbone and/or other quality tools to determine root cause. Corrective actions identified, implemented and verified.
  • A high standard of ethics, professionalism, leadership, competency, and quality are demonstrated
  • Role model for Quality, Customer Satisfaction, Employee Satisfaction and Business Results
  • Contribute program status and technology update presentations for internal technical community (Technology Ops Reviews and Engineering Brown Bag lunches).

Intellectual Property [10%]

  • Trade secrets and patent-able products and processes that support strategic technology advancements and markets are actively pursued and documented.
  • Complementary and advanced technologies (internal and external) are applied to new products and capabilities.
  • Alternate technologies are understood. Includes technology assessments and dissemination of findings as appropriate within the organization.
  • A clear understanding is demonstrated of product performance differences between Coherent and competitor products
  • Technology developments are disseminated to other areas of the company via technical reports, presentations and memos.
  • Technical support and analyses are provided for marketing, engineering and manufacturing as required.

Personal and Professional Development [10%]

  • Actively participate in available training sessions, technical conferences, and workshops. Support and recommend training sessions, conferences, and workshops necessary to maintain technical network and technical knowledge and understanding.
  • Publish internal technical reports and regularly review complementary technology publications.
  • Collect, organize, and interpret large sets of data from various internal sources to identify trends, patterns, and insights to support data-driven decisions across departments

Education & Experience

  • BS or higher technical degree in Engineering, Mechanical Engineering preferred.
  • 9+ years’ applicable experience in thermal management and/or thermoelectric assemblies.

Skills & Other Requirements

  • Ability to analyze heat transfer problems.
  • Proficient computer skills, including SolidWorks, Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, Email, and internet access.
  • ANSYS Mechanical or similar FEA modeling experience required. Icepak, Fluent and Thermoelectric experience a plus.
  • Ability to interpret and appropriately specify GD&T dimensioning and tolerancing.
  • Basic knowledge of electro-mechanical components and PCB/PWB construction.
  • Able to interpret basic electrical schematics, with an understanding of common components (diodes, resistors, mosfets, etc.) and series/parallel circuits.
  • Understands design and fabrication limitations of CNC machining and sheet metal processes.
  • Basic statistical analysis knowledge (normal distribution, standard deviation, etc.) Use of Minitab or other statistics software a plus.
  • Ability to work under direct supervision operating from broad concepts and transform these concepts into concrete program action items/plans.
  • Ability to solve problems in a timely and proficient manner.
  • Good interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills. Prior experience with effectively communicating complex technical concepts to organization team members and external technical contacts.
  • Ability to anticipate and handle multiple programs and priorities.
    • Willing to travel domestically and internationally.

Working Conditions

Full time, onsite, 5 days per week.

Normal office working conditions with occasional exposure to noise, dust, heat, etc. when working in a lab or production area.

Physical Requirements

  • Must be able to remain in a stationary position, often standing or sitting for prolonged periods
  • Must be able to communicate clearly and effectively with others to exchange information
  • Constantly operates a computer and other office equipment
  • Required to wear PPE (including finger cots/gloves, safety glass/shields) when working in lab or production area.
    • Occasional lifting not to exceed 25lbs.

Safety Requirements

All employees are required to attend scheduled training, follow the site EHS procedures and Corporate EHS standards. This includes the use of proper protective equipment (PPE) as required by the job responsibilities.

Managers will ensure that all safety and environmental procedures are followed consistently. They will ensure that risk assessments are performed, proper training, work instructions, required PPE is available, and will monitor compliance.

Quality & Environmental Responsibilities

Depending on location, this position may be responsible for the execution and maintenance of the ISO 9000, 9001, 14001 and/or other applicable standards that may apply to the relevant roles and responsibilities within the Quality Management System and Environmental Management System.

Employees are required to maintain a quality work environment that is safe, clean, organized and environmentally compliant.

Responsible for maintaining Quality Work Environment housekeeping standards for own work area and community areas.

Culture Commitment

Ensure adherence to company’s values (ICARE) in all aspects of your position at Coherent:

I ntegrity – Create an Environment of Trust

C ollaboration – Innovate Through the Sharing of Ideas

A ccountability – Own the Process and the Outcome

R espect – Recognize the Value in Everyone

E nthusiasm – Find a Sense of Purpose in Work


Coherent Corp. is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.


If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at talentacquisition@coherent.com .


Coherent is a global leader in lasers, engineered materials and networking components. We are a vertically integrated manufacturing company that develops innovative products for diversified applications in the industrial, optical communications, military, life sciences, semiconductor equipment, and consumer markets. Coherent provides a comprehensive career development platform within an environment that challenges employees to perform at their best, while rewarding excellence and hard-work through a competitive compensation program. It's an exciting opportunity to work for a company that offers stability, longevity and growth. Come Join Us!

Note to recruiters and employment agencies: We will not pay for unsolicited resumes from recruiters and employment agencies unless we have a signed agreement and have required assistance, in writing, for a specific opening.

title: Data Annotation Engineer
description:
About team

Avride is at the forefront of autonomous mobility, developing and deploying cutting-edge self-driving cars and delivery robots. We're shaping the future of transportation and logistics, and our Data Annotation and Behavior Analysis teams play a vital role in bringing that vision to life.

Our work is organized around two core domains: autonomous vehicles and delivery robots. While each presents unique behavioral patterns and annotation challenges, we follow a unified framework for annotation quality, behavior evaluation, and feedback integration.

The primary goals of these teams are to deliver high-quality labeled data and to understand and evaluate real-world vehicle behavior, supporting continuous improvement in performance, safety, and user experience.

About the Role

We are looking for a Data Annotation Engineer who will focus on testing and optimizing labeling workflows. You will be responsible for developing and refining annotation pipelines, identifying and resolving issues in 3D annotation tools, and creating metrics to assess data quality.

Your work will directly impact how efficiently our annotation team produces accurate and high-quality data for training machine learning models.

We use Python and ClickHouse, and we'd love to hear your ideas on how to use them effectively.

What You'll Do

Annotation Workflows

  • Develop and maintain 3D data labeling pipelines.
  • Collaborate with backend and frontend teams to improve interface usability and the data delivery pipeline.
  • Work with external vendors to ensure consistent data quality standards.

Testing & Troubleshooting

  • Test and evaluate annotation tools to identify bugs, UX issues, and performance bottlenecks.
  • Perform various types of testing (functional, regression, exploratory) on new features.
  • Work closely with developers and product managers to promptly resolve issues.

Quality & Analytics

  • Create and monitor annotation quality metrics, analyze trends, and recommend improvements.
  • Document workflows, best practices, and edge cases for 3D point cloud labeling.
  • Use Python and ClickHouse to analyze data, monitor performance, and support debugging.

What You'll Need

  • Understanding of testing processes (functional, regression, smoke, UI/UX) and experience writing clear bug reports;
  • Python skills for data processing and analysis (Pandas, NumPy);
  • Ability to query databases (experience with ClickHouse is a plus).

Nice to Have

  • Hands-on experience with LiDAR point clouds;
  • Hands-on experience in data annotation or data visualization (preferably with 3D datasets);
  • Experience using semi-automated labeling tools or active learning methods.


Candidates are required to be authorized to work in the U.S. The employer is not offering relocation sponsorship, and remote work options are not available.

title: Senior Software Engineer - AI Agents - Developer Experience Platform, AiDP
description:
Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, we believe new insights have a way of becoming excellent products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there’s no telling what you could accomplish. The people here at Apple don’t just create products - they create the kind of wonder that’s revolutionized entire industries. It’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple, and help us leave the world better than we found it.

Developer Experience Platform team is looking for an extraordinary Python backend engineer who has a robust understanding of Large Language Models (LLMs)and Generative AI to join our team. You will help design, implement the core backend services and pipelines that integrate with various other enterprise services including LLMs and bring Gen AI services. You would support our mission by applying groundbreaking research in this rapidly evolving and exciting space, to our daily work. By contributing to our team, you’ll play an integral part in developing our developer productivity tools, leaving a significant footprint on the evolution of our enterprise AI platforms.

Description

Developer Experience Platform team provides frameworks, services and developer tools to internal engineering teams in Apple to accelerate their SDLC. We are working on a Generative AI based Developer Experience Platform for internal use and assist our app development team. This role involves multiple aspects on the backend, like ensuring LLM based code generation is accurate, and integrating with various enterprise services. You will collaborate with Machine Learning engineers, Software engineers, and other data scientists to deliver and end to end solution for this platform.
